meanings.definition: The quality or state of being acrid.
meanings.sent1: The acridities of the burnt food filled the kitchen with a sharp smell.
meanings.sent2: The acridities of the medicine made it difficult to swallow.
meanings.sent3: The acridities of the spicy sauce made everyone pucker their lips in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The acridities of the argument left a bitter taste in their mouths.
meanings.sent5: The acridities of the smoke stung their eyes and made them cough.

meanings.definition: The presence of an acrid taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: She wrinkled her nose at the acridities of the chemical fumes.
meanings.sent2: The acridities of the spoiled milk made it undrinkable.
meanings.sent3: The acridities of the burnt popcorn made the room smell like a campfire.
meanings.sent4: The acridities of the situation lingered in the air long after the argument was over.
meanings.sent5: The acridities of the cleaning solution made her eyes water as she scrubbed the floor.
